data.en: Extemporaneous speaking should be practiced and cultivated. It is the lawyer's avenue to the public. However able and faithful he may be in other respects, people are slow to bring him business if he cannot make a speech.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Allow the president to invade a neighboring nation whenever he shall deem it necessary to repel an invasion,and you allow him to do so whenever he may choose to say he deems it necessary for such purpose - and you allow him to make war at pleasure.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Never stir up litigation. A worse man can scarcely be found than one who does this.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: There is no grievance that is a fit object of redress by mob law.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Don't swap horses in crossing a stream.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I go to assume a task more difficult than that which devolved upon Washington. Unless the great God, who assisted him, shall be with me and aid me, I must fail; but if the same omniscient mind and almighty arm that directed and protected him shall guide and support me, I shall not fail - I shall succeed.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: We can succeed only by concert. It is not, 'Can any of us imagine better,' but, 'Can we all do better?'

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Why was the amendment, expressly declaring the right of the people to exclude slavery, voted down? Plainly enough now, the adoption of it would have spoiled the niche for the Dred Scott decision.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I care not much for a man's religion whose dog and cat are not the better for it.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Let reverence for the laws be breathed by every American mother to the lisping babe that prattles on her lap - let it be taught in schools, in seminaries, and in colleges; let it be written in primers, spelling books, and in almanacs; let it be preached from the pulpit, proclaimed in legislative halls, and enforced in courts of justice.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Four score and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent, a new nation, conceived in Liberty, and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: If a man had more than one life, I think a little hanging would not hurt this one; but after he is once dead, we cannot bring him back, no matter how sorry we may be; so the boy shall be pardoned.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: To give victory to the right, not bloody bullets, but peaceful ballots only, are necessary.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I can express all my views on the slavery question by quotations from Henry Clay.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I have said a hundred times, and I have no inclination to take it back, that I believe there is no right, and ought to be no inclination in the people of the free States to enter into the slave States, and to interfere with the question of slavery at all. I have said that always.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Most folks are as happy as they make up their minds to be.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: This country, with its institutions, belongs to the people who inhabit it. Whenever they shall grow weary of the existing government, they can exercise their constitutional right of amending it, or exercise their revolutionary right to overthrow it.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: With public sentiment, nothing can fail. Without it, nothing can succeed.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I am naturally anti-slavery. If slavery is not wrong, nothing is wrong. I can not remember when I did not so think and feel.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I was born and have ever remained in the most humble walks of life.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: He has a right to criticize, who has a heart to help.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: A friend is one who has the same enemies as you have.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Don't interfere with anything in the Constitution. That must be maintained, for it is the only safeguard of our liberties.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: In so far as the government lands can be disposed of, I am in favor of cutting up the wild lands into parcels so that every poor man may have a home.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: I have always hated slavery, I think, as much as any abolitionist. I have been an Old Line Whig. I have always hated it, but I have always been quiet about it until this new era of the introduction of the Nebraska Bill began.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: The leading rule for the lawyer, as for the man of every calling, is diligence.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Ballots are the rightful and peaceful successors to bullets.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: My father... removed from Kentucky to... Indiana, in my eighth year... It was a wild region, with many bears and other wild animals still in the woods. There I grew up... Of course when I came of age, I did not know much. Still somehow, I could read, write, and cipher... but that was all.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: If there is anything that a man can do well, I say let him do it. Give him a chance.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Whether slavery shall go into Nebraska, or other new territories, is not a matter of exclusive concern to the people who may go there. The whole nation is interested that the best use shall be made of these territories. We want them for the homes of free white people.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: A man watches his pear tree day after day, impatient for the ripening of the fruit. Let him attempt to force the process, and he may spoil both fruit and tree. But let him patiently wait, and the ripe pear at length falls into his lap.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: Upon the subjects of which I have treated, I have spoken as I have thought. I may be wrong in regard to any or all of them; but, holding it a sound maxim that it is better only sometimes to be right than at all times to be wrong, so soon as I discover my opinions to be erroneous, I shall be ready to renounce them.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: No man is good enough to govern another man without the other's consent.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: To the best of my judgment, I have labored for, and not against, the Union. As I have not felt, so I have not expressed any harsh sentiment towards our Southern brethren. I have constantly declared, as I really believed, the only difference between them and us is the difference of circumstances.

data.author: Abraham Lincoln
data.en: In my view of the present aspect of affairs, there is no need of bloodshed and war. There is no necessity for it. I am not in favor of such a course, and I may say in advance, there will be no blood shed unless it be forced upon the government. The government will not use force unless force is used against it.
